FuncDef:
The qos remark vxlan-qos-local-id enable command enables a device to fill QoS policy IDs in VXLAN headers.
The undo qos remark vxlan-qos-local-id enable command disables a device from filling QoS policy IDs in VXLAN headers.
By default, the function of filling QoS policy IDs in VXLAN headers is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before configuring a traffic policy based on a QoS policy ID in VXLAN packets on a device, you must run the qos remark vxlan-qos-local-id enable command to enable the device to fill the QoS policy ID in VXLAN headers. After this function is enabled, the QoS policy ID is mapped to the three most significant bits of the reserved field in VXLAN packets.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command can be configured only in the admin VS, and takes effect for all VSs.
